question:
Find the correct statement.

(1) Generally a gene regulates a trait, but sometimes one gene has effect on multiple traits.
(2) The trait AB-blood group of man is regulated by one dominant allele and another recessive allele. Hence it is co-dominant.
explanation: Statement (1) is correct (Pleiotropy). Statement (2) is incorrect because AB blood group is regulated by two dominant alleles (<katex>$I^A$</katex> and <katex>$I^B$</katex>) which are co-dominant, not a dominant and recessive allele.
